intro: Dalea arizonica, commonly known as Arizona milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically has trifoliate leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Dalea arizonica plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
